abstract.p: A concept of scale curve based on data-depth was introduced in Liu, Parelius, and Singh. A scale curve describes the growth of a scalar (positive real-valued) scale measure of a multivariate population/data-cloud, as the distribution/data progresses center-outwardly. This article proposes a new concept for a scale curve, called the quantile scale curve, which is conceptually and computationally simpler than a data-depth based scale curve. The article focuses on the data-analytic utility of the proposed quantile scale curve, and in particular on a proposed graphical test for detecting linear and nonlinear association between two groups of variables. Other problems addressed using the concept of a quantile scale curve are exploring heavy-tailedness (via a bootscale plot), and multivariate location and scale testing. The article includes a distributional result on simplicial volumes which is of independent interest. Supplemental materials, including a technical appendix, are available online.
